page.title: 03Local History
page.content: 900 years ago Queen Margaret established a ferry between the North and the South shores of the River Forth so that pilgrims from Edinburgh could visit Dunfermline Abbey.North and South Queensferry were thus established.The ferry ceased to operate in 1964 when Queen Elizabeth opened the Forth Road Bridge.Some street place names reflecting the history of South Queensferry are Port Edgar,Queen Margaret Drive,Atheling Grove,Moubray Grove,Carmelite Road, Ferrymuir Lane.Some streets are named after local dignitaries_Walker Drive, John Mason Court,Hugh Russel Place, Provost Milne Grove.North Queensferry names are Mounthooly Place,Post Office Lane and Helen Lane which may be derived from Herring Lane.
